reviews.review_msg: needs to upgrade- no webct, no powerpoint, no other resources. He leaves you at the mercy to his oddball, tricky mulitple choice exams that focus on wording not content or understanding of material. I wouldn't mind chatting to him at a party, but I would not want to take another one of his classes.
Thinks he knows something, but has no clue.  Probably wanted to be bad at one point, but didn't have the guts to take the plunge.  Coward.
don't take this class if you're looking for an easy elective...you won't be happy

clearly has white guilt and everything has to do with aboriginal culture. Please don't take her class. Professors should not include their political and personal beliefs into their teachings as I have learned nothing in this class.

Brenda is nice but this course literally is not what the Course description says. no need to attend lecture as you aren't tested on anything. paper had unclear expectations and she was unable to provide concrete feedback. save yourself and just take this class with another prof

so disappointed as I was excited to learn the topics that shouldve been covered in class. What a waste of money and time. Slides filled with quotes- and worksheets were due every week (you can submit them late though in exchange for marks off). She obviously has white guilt which probably causes her to focus on irrelevant indigenous topics.

Disorganized teaching style.Course was fully focused on indigenous concepts and teachings rather than psychological explanations.Tons of random readings & long podcasts.Expectations for the final 12pg essay were unclear until last min and my wonderful TA mentioned asking her many times for clarification but could not get any. Don't take her class.
if you think ur gonna come to class, don't. literally nothing mentioned is relevant
not it, boss

If you can take this course with a different prof DO IT. Brenda is horribly disorganized and taught no core concepts. We got random emails for podcasts to listen to for Monday lecture ON A SUNDAY NIGHT. No real grading criteria, it was posted on lecture slides and wasn't even written by her. This should be an easy class but she makes it awful.

I tried to switch classes but failed. This course is NOT psychological and is all Indigenous based- which is important but not what is described when enrolling. The slides are all quotes. There are 'worksheets' every week as well and the final is 12 pages which has has the criteria changed multiple times and locked until asked not to be. Don't take

Do not make my mistake and listen to the prof ratings. Most of the course was her talking about anything else other than the course content. Instructions were unclear, most tutorials students would hound the TA for instructions. Everyone was confused on the course. This classes content isn't difficult, only difficult because the prof.
BRING FENT!
Learned more about the psychology of deviance and crime from saul Goodman

Brenda, while passionate about what she is talking about, made this course not at all what it is supposed to be. every topic we covered pretty much had nothing to do with psychological explanations of crime. no point in going to any of the lectures as none of the information in them is useful
Overall Brenda is a good prof but her lecture can get a bit boring. Also she talks more about other  subjects rather than what the course is suppose to be about.
Brenda is passionate about what she teaches. They are approachable, always willing to help, and provide clear explanations. The course was engaging, and I felt well-supported throughout.

My friend took crim 103 with J. Wong, learned about psychopaths, drugs, m*rderers, and interesting theories of crime.

In this class with Morrison though, you'll learn none of this, or she will touch on a topic lightly and that's it.

The class is easy, no exams, but if you want to learn about interesting topics don't take it with her.

Horrible, most of the things she rambles on about in lecture has nothing to do with course material. I understand that cultural appreciation is important, but I'm here to learn about criminology, not indigenous studies.

Brenda's teaching methods are completely USELESS for the average person. Her lecture slides are mainly confusing quotes and she ramles about everything and anything that could not be any less related to the course. I have attended every lecture and tutorial and have not learned a single thing about psychology or criminology. DO NOT TAKE
Brenda is very messy and goes on rambles during lectures without making a point. She quotes more people in her lecture slides than actually giving us information and definitions. DO NOT TAKE!!

I waited 3 years to get into this class because the enrolment system sucks. Brenda does not cover ANYTHING about psychology and barely touches on her own lecture slides. No point in going to lecture, honestly don't waste your money if she is the prof. You won't learn anything or benefit from this. Extremely disappointed and SFU needs to fix this.

I am a third year student and I can confidently say this is the worst professor I have had at this school so far. Her lectures didn't teach us anything, I wouldn't recommend going. She assigns heavy reading and video material, like being assigned 2 hours of video to watch and a bunch of readings. If you are enrolled, find a different class or prof.

Dr. Morrison's teachings are irrelevant to what is listed in the description of this course as there is nothing about biogenetic, psychiatric, and psychological explanations of crime and deviance. She instead focuses on Indigenous and social explanations, which although are important, are not what we PAID to learn. Nothing about psychology. AVOID!!
she just compared a domestic terrorist with someone who chopped down a tree...
Terrible course she didn't show up and the essay was worth 45% of the grade that had nothing to do with "psychological explanations".

Do not take this class with this teacher. She teaches nothing that has to do with psychological explanations and all to do with indigenous explanations. It seems she neglected this course to be more present for her other courses.

Brenda needs to be studied. She taught us NOTHING about the psychology of crime and deviance, setting us up to struggle in our next courses. Class was always cancelled, or didn't bother giving a notice. We paid for an in-person class but were given an online class. She rambles about Indigenous people for the entirety of every Zoom lecture. dont.

Brenda canceled all but two classes to attend to her personal projects and left us to deal with her annoying laptop in zoom classes. We had no solid outline for our term project, you had to dig for information from recorded lectures. The TA was nice but we wouldn't get our grades or feedback in time to add changes to our next work. Don't take it!!!

Brenda cancelled 8/10 of her lectures and seemed to want to pursue her own little passion projects rather than teach us about Crime and Deviance. She didn't talk about crime and deviance at all and it was Indigenous based, not criminology based. Her own TA referred us to a youtube playlist because Brenda didnt teach us anything. 0/10 dont take this

unbelievable course that has nothing to do with the name: psychological explanations. all we talked about was indigenous stuff I didn't pay my money to learn. She was crying in the online (supposed to be in person) lectures, super unprofessional. make sure when taking Crim 103 that it isn't with brenda Morrison. sad class. waste of money.

There actually needs to be something done about this professor. How can she get away by teaching us a course like this??? Why is she even teaching if she cannot actually hold an in person class because her life is apparently so complicated. Someone needs to email the dean about this or something. This class will waste peoples money and is not okay!

(part 3) I feel bad for everyone taking this course like I am! By the way she was also crying in a few of the zoom lectures which I thought was odd because there was no professionalism whatsoever. Attendance was semi-mandatory (mainly for tutorial).

(part 2) My mark for the paper outline and annotated bibliography were decent but still!! What is this?! The TA was Chelsey Lee and she also taught this course to which she told us to refer to Evan McCuish another CRIM prof here at SFU. THATS CRAZY

(part 1) I do not recommend taking ANY courses with this professor, she actually made criminology uninteresting with her constant rants of god knows what!! The TA was rarely helpful and when it came to asking questions about the paper the TA nor the PROF would be able to give a clear answer up until the FINAL WEEK!!!

I don't feel like i learned anything new from this class in terms of criminological theory. Brenda's speciality is restorative
justice, and when she did lecture, it was pretty interesting, but it was not what I paid to learn. I paid for an in-person class and got an online class that was loosely based on course material.

Worst professor in sfu, cancels lectures and uses the most dishonest excuses. Completely disregards the fact that students taking criminology need to learn certain topics to help with understanding upper level courses by completely changing Crim 103 to her class. Needs fired ASAP!!!!!!!!!!!

Worst Crim class ive taken so far. This isn't even psychological explanations, rather indigenous perspectives. She made so many excuses for not showing up to class like ive never seen anything like this before.
cancels classes at the last minute, rarely shows up, doesn't actually teach anything, talks a lot without saying anything
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! Take a different teacher please!!!!!!!!!!! The recent ratings on this prof aren't for nothing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Take another course or save your hard earned dollars!!!!

what an absolute joke of a course. I can't believe that this person has a job that pays decently well like a university prof. She is cheating her way through life with this joke that we call crim103. Something has to be done about this. We should be refunded for what is this atrocity of a university course.

PLEASEEE DO NOT TAKE CRIM 103 WITH HER IF YOU ACTUALLY WANTED TO LEARN ABOUT PHYSIOLOGICAL EXPLANATIONS OF CRIMINAL AND DEVIANT BEHAVIOR. She first of all made this an online class with cancelling all of her in person classes except for 2! The amount of excuses she had to come up with were hilarious because why am I paying for an in person class.

PART 3: Her focus on this course does not revolve around psychology at all, rather Indigenous studies, which is her field of work. If you want to take this course, take it with Evan McCuish. His course is specific to psychological deviances and crimes. I fell to my knees cause I can't take this class anymore and wasted 600 bucks. Trash ahh class.

PART 2: She puts in minimal work but expects us to be detailed and meet every single one of her expectations as well. Her assignment instructions are super vague and will only give out the informative and detailed outline of the assignments if students bombard her email with questions about it.

PART 1: Terrible x10^10. She somehow made this in person class an online one and proceeded to cancel majority of the classes during this semester. The fact that she could find so many excuses to cancel them amazes me. It ranged from being sick 2 weeks in a row to being emotionally burdened by an insignificant event, to being busy on her work.

oh my goodness. i can't even describe her inadequacy. although it was an in person class, brenda canceled more than half of the lectures with a range of excuses. one day she was stuck in a different city, the next day a tree fell in front of her house, then she simply canceled without reason. she gave us nothing and expects so much
